quote: The people to fear are not those who disagree with you, but those who disagree with you and are too cowardly to let you know.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Do not fear mistakes. There are none.
author: Miles Davis

quote: Never be afraid to sit a while and think.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: An exciting and inspiring future awaits you beyond the noise in your mind, beyond the guilt, doubt, fear, shame, insecurity and heaviness of the past you carry around.
author: Debbie Ford

quote: Intimacy is not a happy medium. It is a way of being in which the tension between distance and closeness is dissolved and a new horizon appears. Intimacy is beyond fear.
author: Henri Nouwen

quote: You need to let go of your fear and anxiety of being judged by others.
author: Gavin Newsom

quote: Do the thing you fear to do and keep on doing it... that is the quickest and surest way ever yet discovered to conquer fear.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: No one should have to choose between medicine and other necessities. No one should have to use the emergency room every time a child gets sick. And no one should have to live in constant fear that a medical problem will become a financial crisis.
author: Brad Henry

quote: It may be you fear more to deliver judgment upon me than I fear judgment.
author: Giordano Bruno

quote: Men are moved by two levers only: fear and self interest.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: I was always afraid of dying. Always. It was my fear that made me learn everything I could about my airplane and my emergency equipment, and kept me flying respectful of my machine and always alert in the cockpit.
author: Chuck Yeager

quote: I play with a fear of letting people down. That's what motivates me.
author: Jonny Wilkinson

quote: Fear is the only true enemy, born of ignorance and the parent of anger and hate.
author: Edward Albert

quote: I have no fear of being less beautiful, I've always been afraid of not being beautiful.
author: Isabelle Adjani

quote: Hunger and fear are the only realities in dog life: an empty stomach makes a fierce dog.
author: Robert Falcon Scott

quote: What scares me? Oh, now that's a big question. I don't know what scares me - cockroaches, nuclear apocalypse. Fear is an interesting thing. It has a place in all of our lives. I try to be as fearless as possible. I don't always succeed, but I like to think I try.
author: Zachary Quinto

quote: I have stepped outside my comfort zone enough to know that, yes, the world does fall apart, but not in the way that you fear.
author: Tan Le

quote: Guatemala's ornate presidential palace, once a terrifying fortress whose every corridor was patrolled by heavily armed soldiers in berets and camouflage uniforms, is now a normal public building where ordinary citizens enter without fear.
author: Stephen Kinzer

quote: There are very few monsters who warrant the fear we have of them.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Every man, through fear, mugs his aspirations a dozen times a day.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: We fear things in proportion to our ignorance of them.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Boldness is a mask for fear, however great.
author: John Dryden

quote: Love is what we were born with. Fear is what we learned here.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: There is no passion so contagious as that of fear.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Fear is static that prevents me from hearing myself.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Grief has limits, whereas apprehension has none. For we grieve only for what we know has happened, but we fear all that possibly may happen.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: By adversity are wrought the greatest works of admiration, and all the fair examples of renown, out of distress and misery are grown.
author: Samuel Daniel

quote: The pleasures of love are always in proportion to our fears.
author: Stendhal

quote: I had to confront my fears and master my every demonic thought about inferiority, insecurity, or the fear of being black, young, and gifted in this Western culture.
author: Lauryn Hill

quote: When the U.S. claims the right to invade any country unilaterally and then defines a country like Iran or North Korea as 'evil,' then it is a rational response for these countries to develop nuclear weapons as the only military deterrent to invasion. We create what we most fear.
author: Dean Ornish

quote: Seeing that a Pilot steers the ship in which we sail, who will never allow us to perish even in the midst of shipwrecks, there is no reason why our minds should be overwhelmed with fear and overcome with weariness.
author: John Calvin

quote: If you fear making anyone mad, then you ultimately probe for the lowest common denominator of human achievement.
author: Jimmy Carter

quote: Liberalism is trust of the people tempered by prudence. Conservatism is distrust of the people tempered by fear.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Love casts out fear, but we have to get over the fear in order to get close enough to love them.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: We do not just fear our predators, we are transfixed by them. We are prone to weave stories and fables and chat endlessly about them.
author: Peter Benchley

quote: For me, it was never a question of whether or not I was transgender. It was a question of what I'd be able to handle transitioning and having to do it in the public eye. One of the issues that was hard for me to overcome was the fear of that.
author: Chaz Bono

quote: I love the ocean. I've always liked the blue, so tranquil and peaceful and gliding. And the fear of it.
author: Siouxsie Sioux

quote: The deepest parts of you know that if freedom from fear was as easy as 'creating a new reality' for yourself, then you would already be the fearless person you know in your heart that you're meant to be.
author: Guy Finley

quote: When political leaders fail to denounce anti-Semitic violence and slurs, the void is not only demoralizing to the victims, but silence actually enables the wrongdoing. Silence by elected officials in particular conveys approval - or at least acquiescence - and can contribute to a climate of fear and a sense of vulnerability.
author: Chris Smith

quote: It's okay to have fear - we're all human; it happens - but in facing your fears, you can really open yourself up to things you never thought possible.
author: Katherine McNamara

quote: I don't fear that a man will wear out as quickly as he will rust out.
author: Colonel Sanders

quote: You block your dream when you allow your fear to grow bigger than your faith.
author: Mary Manin Morrissey

quote: A man who is not afraid is not aggressive, a man who has no sense of fear of any kind is really a free, a peaceful man.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Valor grows by daring, fear by holding back.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: It is a great mystery that though the human heart longs for Truth, in which alone it finds liberation and delight, the first reaction of human beings to Truth is one of hostility and fear!
author: Anthony de Mello

quote: Knight without fear and without reproach.
author: Richard Harris Barham

quote: I have been thinking about the notion of perfect love as being without fear, and what that means for us in a world that's becoming increasingly xenophobic, tortured by fundamentalism and nationalism.
author: bell hooks

quote: I have no fear of photography as long as it cannot be used in heaven and in hell.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: The real and effectual discipline which is exercised over a workman is that of his customers. It is the fear of losing their employment which restrains his frauds and corrects his negligence.
author: Adam Smith

quote: I fear those big words which make us so unhappy.
author: James Joyce

quote: I am so tired of fear. And I don't want my girls to live in a country, in a world, based on fear.
author: Michelle Obama

quote: Eighty percent of all choices are based on fear. Most people don't choose what they want they choose what they think is safe.
author: Phil McGraw

quote: When someone fears losing your affection, he or she will strive to keep it. Perhaps you have strived to keep someone's affection, too. Fear of loss is not love.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: National politics and elections are dominated by emotions, by lack of self-confidence, by fear of the other, by insecurity, by infection of the body politic by the virus of victimhood.
author: Tariq Ramadan

quote: I don't have a fear of becoming a parent, but I do have a fear of taking care of a newborn because they are so tiny and vulnerable.
author: Lindsay Price

quote: Fear paralyses you - fear of flying, fear of the future, fear of leaving a rubbish marriage, fear of public speaking, or whatever it is.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Someone asked me if I was afraid to write my memoirs. I told him: 'We have to stop drawing up accounts of fear! We live in a society in which people are allowed to tell their story, and that is what I do.'
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: Logically, harmony must come from the heart... Harmony very much based on trust. As soon as use force, creates fear. Fear and trust cannot go together.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: In the weeks after 9/11, out of the pain and the fear there arose also grace and gratitude, eruptions of intense kindness that occurred everywhere, a sharp resolve to just be better, bigger, to shed the nonsense, rise to the occasion.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: Shyness is invariably a suppression of something. It's almost a fear of what you're capable of.
author: Rhys Ifans

quote: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past, I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone, there will be nothing. Only I will remain.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: We younger Negro artists who create now intend to express our individual dark-skinned selves without fear or shame. If white people are pleased, we are glad. If they are not, it doesn't matter. We know we are beautiful. And ugly too.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Leaders are visionaries with a poorly developed sense of fear and no concept of the odds against them.
author: Robert Jarvik

quote: We need to teach the next generation of children from day one that they are responsible for their lives. Mankind's greatest gift, also its greatest curse, is that we have free choice. We can make our choices built from love or from fear.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
author: Leon Blum

quote: Everywhere that freedom stirs, let tyrants fear.
author: George W. Bush

quote: What comes out when life squeezes you? When someone hurts or offends you? If anger, pain and fear come out of you, it's because that's what's inside.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Everyone has his faults which he continually repeats: neither fear nor shame can cure them.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Mysticism and exaggeration go together. A mystic must not fear ridicule if he is to push all the way to the limits of humility or the limits of delight.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Dare to be honest and fear no labor.
author: Robert Burns

quote: He whose head is in heaven need not fear to put his feet into the grave.
author: Matthew Henry

quote: Identifying and overcoming natural fear is one of the pleasing struggles intrinsic to climbing.
author: Alex Lowe

quote: In this life struggle, here I am among you fully cognizant that a true believer has no fear of what God has ordained for him. Those who are visited by fear live only for their present, under the illusion that the world began with them and will end with their departure.
author: Hussein of Jordan

quote: We all have a fear of the unknown what one does with that fear will make all the difference in the world.
author: Lillian Russell

quote: Events that are predestined require but little management. They manage themselves. They slip into place while we sleep, and suddenly we are aware that the thing we fear to attempt, is already accomplished.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: All religions are founded on the fear of the many and the cleverness of the few.
author: Stendhal

quote: God, make me so uncomfortable that I will do the very thing I fear.
author: Ruby Dee

quote: There's no reason for the establishment to fear me. But it has every right to fear the people collectively - I am one with the people.
author: Huey Newton

quote: Fear, conformity, immorality: these are heavy burdens. They drain us of creative energy. And when we are drained of creative energy, we do not create. We procreate, but we do not create.
author: David McCallum

quote: Worry does not mean fear, but readiness for the confrontation.
author: Bashar al-Assad

quote: This fear of the Lord is indeed the beginning of wisdom. This consciousness of sin is the straight pathway to heaven.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

quote: Because of the lack of education on AIDS, discrimination, fear, panic, and lies surrounded me.
author: Ryan White

quote: Whether it is the old lady's fear, or the many ghostly traditions of this place, or the crucifix itself, I do not know, but I am not feeling nearly as easy in my mind as usual.
author: Bram Stoker

quote: Whenever there is fear, you will get wrong figures.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Worry is a cycle of inefficient thoughts whirling around a center of fear.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

quote: I have no fear that the candle lighted in Palestine years ago will ever be put out.
author: Dean Inge

quote: Falsehood is invariably the child of fear in one form or another.
author: Aleister Crowley

quote: I don't run away from a challenge because I am afraid. Instead, I run toward it because the only way to escape fear is to trample it beneath your feet.
author: Nadia Comaneci

quote: Fear not, the people may be deluded for a moment, but cannot be corrupted.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: I'm intimidated by the fear of being average.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: I get so nervous on stage I can't help but talk. I try. I try telling my brain: stop sending words to the mouth. But I get nervous and turn into my grandma. Behind the eyes it's pure fear. I find it difficult to believe I'm going to be able to deliver.
author: Adele

quote: I'm always interested in trying to investigate different personalities. I want to keep myself guessing and keep the fear element alive, so that I don't get too comfortable.
author: Michael Fassbender

quote: Americans are apocalyptic by nature. The reason why is that we've always had so much, so we live in deadly fear that people are going to take it away from us.
author: Stephen King

quote: To talk about balance, it's easier to talk about what's out of balance. And I think anytime that you have any disease, and disease meaning lack of ease, lack of flow... dis-ease. So any time there's disease, you're out of balance, whether it's jealousy, anger, greed, anxiety, fear.
author: Ricky Williams

quote: I'm a guy who has problems with moderation. All or nothing. Binge and purge. Kill or be killed. Gray is not a color I wear well. I should be dead. I know that. I should not be successful. I know that too. My daily existence is a toss of the coin - one side, fear, the other side, gratitude.
author: Kurt Sutter

quote: I don't believe in fear - I live my life without regrets.
author: Sean Combs

quote: I like to do something I fear.
author: Heath Ledger

quote: Finally, a good prosecutor knows that her job is to enforce the law without fear or favor. Likewise, a Supreme Court Justice must interpret the laws without fear or favor.
author: Amy Klobuchar

quote: And I'm a pretty positive person - I don't put a lot of energy into worrying, and I'm not a person who lives in a great deal of fear.
author: Rachel Hunter

quote: When you say 'fear of the unknown', that is the definition of fear; fear is the unknown, fear is what you do not know, and it's genetically within us so that we feel safe. We feel scared of the woods because we're not familiar with it, and that keeps you safe.
author: M. Night Shyamalan

quote: When men don't fear God, they give themselves to evil.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: I've been quite fascinated by the relative insignificance of human existence, the shortness of life. We might as well be a letter in a word in a sentence on a page in a book in a library in a city in one country in this enormous universe! And that kind of fear and insignificance has kept me awake at night.
author: Laura Marling

quote: 'Dream Act' kids are like all other American kids, with the exception that they have to work harder to excel in school, they live in fear of deportation, and they worry about their future.
author: Jeff Hawkins

quote: A lot of people would say 'sexy' is about the body. But to me, 'sexy' is a woman with confidence. I admire women who have very little fear.
author: Allegra Versace

quote: The bracelet says 'Fear Nothing.' It was given to me by my friends, and it was made for me and my friends during the period of time that I was going through chemotherapy. And I still wear it, because it's a great reminder of friendship and how my buddies and others came together in my time of need.
author: Joseph J. Lhota

quote: There is that awful moment when you realize that you're falling in love. That should be the most joyful moment, and actually it's not. It's always a moment that's full of fear because you know, as night follows day, the joy is going to rapidly be followed by some pain or other. All the angst of a relationship.
author: Helen Mirren

quote: I greatly fear some of America's greatest and most dangerous enemies are such as think themselves her best friends.
author: Nathan Hale

quote: I'm sure the feeling of fear, as long as you can take advantage of it and not be rendered useless by it, can make you extend yourself beyond what you would regard as your capacity. If you're afraid, the blood seems to flow freely through the veins, and you really do feel a sense of stimulation.
author: Edmund Hillary

quote: Every journey starts with fear.
author: Jake Gyllenhaal

quote: For me, there is only love and fear.
author: Pink

quote: Positive health means becoming whole-heartedly engaged with our own health care. It means not outsourcing our health to the health care system. It means getting rid of the fear and paralysis we too often feel, and instead cultivating a sense of agency.
author: Jane McGonigal

quote: A writer of fiction lives in fear. Each new day demands new ideas, and he can never be sure whether he is going to come up with them or not.
author: Michael Hayden

quote: I express things through characters because I have a fear that my own voice is irritating because that's been said to me.
author: Maria Bamford

quote: Usually when I start a new project there's a fear of the unknown; maybe it's a band I've never been in the studio with before. People are so different. It's almost like you need to go through the process, discover and unlock what it is that makes that band that band. And a lot of times they don't know it.
author: Rick Rubin

quote: An honest cop still can't find a place to go and complain without fear of recrimination. The blue wall will always be there because the system supports it.
author: Frank Serpico

quote: I haven't always been thrilled with my work. But the fear of not proving the people wrong who think you can't emerge from a franchise and do well, that's a very strong driving force.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

quote: Like a blazing comet, I've traversed infinite nights, interstellar spaces of the imagination, voluptuousness and fear.
author: Antonio Tabucchi

quote: There was a point where I was making four movies a year. I was always on a set. I had no stories to tell. I was feeling empty. My life was just luggage and hotels and from set to set, from character to character. And one day, I said, 'And where is mine?' You know? And the moment I started to feel that fear, I stopped and I slowed down.
author: Penelope Cruz

quote: What you wear for work should be comfortable and empowering. If you're working in business, your outfit should mean business. If I go to meet somebody about an acting job, or something creative, then I'll be in my jeans. For me, overdressing is my biggest fear.
author: Twiggy

quote: The first several years of my life were used to upload incredible amounts of fear, and I just became afraid of everything. I was afraid of my parents, afraid of my classmates, afraid of the streets of Washington, D.C. I would flinch at every gesture.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: Man's greatest fear is chaos.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: No American should live in fear of going to work or sending their kids to school. Let's end the fear. Let's enforce existing gun laws.
author: Charles B. Rangel

quote: My main focus in sobriety has been to replace fear with faith or love.
author: Steve-O

quote: Most damage that others do us is out of fear, humiliation and pain. Those feelings occur in all of us, not just in those of us who profess a certain religious or racial devotion.
author: Alice Walker

quote: See how fortune deludes us, and that which we put carefully into her hands, she either breaks or lets it fall from her hands, or causes it to be removed by the violence of another, or suffocates and poisons, or taints with suspicion, fear and jealousy to the great hurt and ruin of the possessor.
author: Giordano Bruno

quote: The raccoons, foxes, beavers, chinchillas, minks, rabbits, and yes, sometimes even dogs and cats that are killed for fur are not very different from your beloved dog or cat. They all have eyes, ears and hearts. They all experience pain when they are physically maimed. They shake with fear when they experience terror.
author: Jane Velez-Mitchell

quote: The process of spotting fear and refusing to obey it is the source of all true empowerment.
author: Martha Beck

quote: But now having seen him which is invisible I fear not what man can do unto me.
author: Anne Hutchinson

quote: My coming to faith did not start with a leap but rather a series of staggers from what seemed like one safe place to another. Like lily pads, round and green, these places summoned and then held me up while I grew. Each prepared me for the next leaf on which I would land, and in this way I moved across the swamp of doubt and fear.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: I do not fear Satan half so much as I fear those who fear him.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: Faith activates God - Fear activates the Enemy.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: There are African-American families around this country - a large, large number of African-American families - that operate out of complete fear that their kids are going to be taken from them and will do anything to prevent that.
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

quote: I think fear is one of the natural states of most actors, to be honest.
author: James McAvoy

quote: Fear can be good when you're walking past an alley at night or when you need to check the locks on your doors before you go to bed, but it's not good when you have a goal and you're fearful of obstacles. We often get trapped by our fears, but anyone who has had success has failed before.
author: Queen Latifah

quote: No passion so effectually robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Probably I have more phobias, fear and eccentricities than I would care to admit. I don't think I'm in danger of losing my mind, but I do often question my own behavior. I have a very bad temper, and it's not always healthy for me and for others. I make my way in the world more difficult, and I could do with a little more yoga.
author: Denis O'Hare

quote: The mark of fear is not easily removed.
author: Ernest Gaines

quote: I do still get extremely nervous before speeches. My biggest fear is that I'll be standing there in front of hundreds of people and be incapable of talking. I'm afraid that I'll make a complete fool of myself and be unable to go on.
author: Marcus Buckingham

quote: Our redemption through the suffering of Christ is that deeper love within us which not only frees us from slavery to sin, but also secures for us the true liberty of the children of God, in order that we might do all things out of love rather than out of fear - love for him that has shown us such grace that no greater can be found.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Dread, which is closely related to fear, steals the ability to enjoy ordinary life and makes people anxious about the future. It keeps them from looking forward to the next day, the next month, or the next decade.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: I definitely think cheerleaders have no fear.
author: Ashley Tisdale

quote: So long as the most vulnerable people in our population are consigned to places that the rest of us will always shun and flee and view with fear, I am afraid that educational denial, medical and economic devastation, and aesthetic degradation will be inevitable.
author: Jonathan Kozol

quote: My story is a freedom song of struggle. It is about finding one's purpose, how to overcome fear and to stand up for causes bigger than one's self.
author: Coretta Scott King

quote: We should not fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future; men of discernment deal only with the present moment.
author: Chanakya

quote: The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers.
author: Judy Blume

quote: A word does not frighten the man who, in acting, feels no fear.
author: Sophocles

quote: I'm not one of those guys that has a great worldview. I kind of deal with terror and fear and isolation and abandonment.
author: David Bowie

quote: I have a vision of India: an India free of hunger and fear, an India free of illiteracy and want.
author: Atal Bihari Vajpayee

quote: I've always had a huge fear of dying or becoming ill. The thing I'm most afraid of, though, is being alone, which I think a lot of performers fear. It's why we seek the limelight - so we're not alone, were adored. We're loved, so people want to be around us. The fear of being alone drives my life.
author: Jennifer Lopez

quote: I never, ever thought I would be able to grow a beard like I have now. I think it's gonna be here for a little minute. Fear the beard, hopefully.
author: Odell Beckham, Jr.

quote: Fear is the foundation of safety.
author: Tertullian

quote: Because the biological mechanisms that affect our health and well-being are so dynamic, when people change their diet and lifestyle, they usually feel so much better, so quickly; it reframes the reason for changing from fear of dying to joy of living. Also, the support that patients give each other is a powerful motivator.
author: Dean Ornish

quote: Fear has many eyes and can see things underground.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Where there is reverence there is fear, but there is not reverence everywhere that there is fear, because fear presumably has a wider extension than reverence.
author: Socrates

quote: I've always had to conquer fear when I'm on stage. Basically, I was and still am a very shy person. It's absolutely in conflict with what I do. But once I deliver the first joke I'm okay. It's like I'm out there all by myself just delivering my lines to nobody in particular without ever trying to notice the audience in front of me.
author: Steven Wright

quote: It sounds funny, but my biggest fear is that I'm not perfect. I'm a perfectionist, and I get upset when things go wrong or when I don't do well.
author: Nick Jonas

quote: Not being happy really is my fear.
author: Keke Palmer

quote: Senators say they fear the N.R.A. and the gun lobby. But I think that fear must be nothing compared to the fear the first graders in Sandy Hook Elementary School felt as their lives ended in a hail of bullets.
author: Gabrielle Giffords

quote: We fear to know the fearsome and unsavory aspects of ourselves, but we fear even more to know the godlike in ourselves.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: 'Amusement' is appealing because we don't have to think it spares us the fear and anxiety that might otherwise prey on our thoughts.
author: John Ortberg

quote: Fear not that thy life shall come to an end, but rather that it shall never have a beginning.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: Don't be afraid to see what you see.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: I've come to the conclusion that mythology is really a form of archaeological psychology. Mythology gives you a sense of what a people believes, what they fear.
author: George Lucas

quote: Having a child, that's always been my biggest fear. I want a child and I fear a child.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You can't be afraid to put out a fire if you're a fireman. You can't be afraid to be a police officer and carry a gun if you're afraid to get up and go out there. So you've got to put that fear to the side and go out in faith to overcome that.
author: Duane Chapman

quote: 'Freedom from fear' could be said to sum up the whole philosophy of human rights.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Fear may very well be a caveman fear of the predator, of the giant lizard chasing them - maybe that's what Steven Spielberg connects with so well in Lost World.
author: Oliver Stone

quote: The scariest thought in the world is that someday I'll wake up and realize I've been sleepwalking through my life: underappreciating the people I love, making the same hurtful mistakes over and over, a slave to neuroses, fear, and the habitual.
author: George Saunders

quote: For me, personally, when I'm afraid of something - when you're afraid of something, normally you try to go away, you try to avoid it. Instead of avoiding it, to overcome your fear, I believe you need to embrace it.
author: Georges St-Pierre

quote: I still worry that I could be better. That's where standards come from, from not wanting to settle. The fear of not being good enough propels you.
author: April Bloomfield

quote: Dolls fire our collective imagination, for better and - too often - for worse. From life-size dolls the same height as the little girls who carry them, to dolls whose long hair can 'grow' longer, to Barbie and her fashionable sisters, dolls do double duty as child's play and the focus of adult art and adult fear.
author: Ellen Datlow

quote: Fear may come true that which one is afraid of.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: The injury that we do to a man must be such that we need not fear his vengeance.
author: Steve Perry

quote: I had a fear of being alone.
author: Gloria Gaynor

quote: Fear has been a big battle, it runs rampant in my sport so I love to overcome that, to challenge it head on, because there is nothing that feels as accomplished as overcoming a fear, and something that has blocked you in such a big way.
author: Laura Wilkinson

quote: You're not human if you don't feel fear. But I've learnt to treat fear as an emotion that sharpens me. It's there to give me that edge for what I have to do.
author: Bear Grylls

quote: Stage fright is my worst problem. A voice is very intimate. It's something of your own. So there's always this fear, because you feel naked. There's a fear of not reaching up to expectations.
author: Andrea Bocelli

quote: Love is the total absence of fear. Love asks no questions. Its natural state is one of extension and expansion, not comparison and measurement.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: Men are swayed more by fear than by reverence.
author: Aristotle

quote: Whoever has not begun the practice of prayer, I beg for the love of the Lord not to go without so great a good. There is nothing here to fear but only something to desire.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: My 'fear' is my substance, and probably the best part of me.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: To pity distress is but human to relieve it is Godlike.
author: Horace Mann

quote: Bathtub falls and police officers kill more Americans than terrorism, yet we've been asked to sacrifice our most sacred rights for fear of falling victim to it.
author: Edward Snowden

quote: Being an entrepreneur means the ability to think out of the box by putting away our fear of any risk, including financial.
author: Ciputra

quote: American economists can't understand the German fear of inflation and the effects of inflation when dealing with the world economic crisis. They wonder why Germany pursues such a different course - 'Why can't they agree with us?' I would have thought it was fairly obvious.
author: Simon Rattle

quote: A company is stronger if it is bound by love rather than by fear.
author: Herb Kelleher

quote: With something like cancer, there is a feeling that you can fight it in some way or control your response to it, but with dementia there is the fear of losing control of your mind and your life.
author: Kevin Whately

quote: We have enforced a Darwinian process on wolves, turning them into the shy and elusive animals they've become. They didn't have that fear of us 30,000 years ago. We didn't have gunpowder; we had rocks. Wolves would have seen us as lunch, and we were weak and slow and tasty.
author: Bruce Cameron

quote: Never fear to deliberately walk through dark places, for that is how you reach the light on the other side.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: Discipline strengthens the mind so that it becomes impervious to the corroding influence of fear.
author: Bernard Law Montgomery

quote: Try a thing you haven't done three times. Once, to get over the fear of doing it. Twice, to learn how to do it. And a third time to figure out whether you like it or not.
author: Virgil Thomson

quote: It is curious how, from time immemorial, man seems to have associated the idea of evil with beauty, shrunk from it with a sort of ghostly fear, while, at the same time drawn to it by force of its hypnotic attraction.
author: Richard Le Gallienne

quote: In the ring, I never really knew fear.
author: Rocky Marciano

quote: How does one kill fear, I wonder? How do you shoot a specter through the heart, slash off its spectral head, take it by its spectral throat?
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: The generality of men are naturally apt to be swayed by fear rather than reverence, and to refrain from evil rather because of the punishment that it brings than because of its own foulness.
author: Aristotle

quote: Always be courageous and strong, and don't fear.
author: Gabby Douglas

quote: I came from a very loving home, had a happy life with no great aspirations, but going to the seminary changed me. There was a chunk of my childhood missing. Once I'd realised it wasn't for me, I still felt a tremendous pressure to continue for fear of letting everybody down.
author: Johnny Vegas

quote: Five decades ago, as India's first prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, began visibly ailing, the nation and the world were consumed by the question: 'After Nehru, who?' The inexpressible fear lay in the subtext to the question: 'After Nehru, what?'
author: Shashi Tharoor

quote: I have lived so long among people who do not understand me, been so long accustomed to refrain and disguise myself for fear of being laughed at, that I have grown as difficult to come at as a snail in a shell; and what is worse, I cannot come out of my shell when I wish it.
author: Jane Welsh Carlyle

quote: For me, it's a real shock to see American mainstream films. I can't see these films because it's always the same thing to me. This is very American. Violence is very American, and I can't understand these films. Why do they use violence? To show what? Masculinity? To show fear? Defense? What are you showing with all this violence?
author: Javier Camara

quote: Let us go forth with fear and courage and rage to save the world.
author: Grace Paley

quote: Jealousy, greed, fear. We're all full of these things. But also love and compassion. If you saw a drowning baby, it wouldn't matter if you were wearing a tuxedo on the way to your own wedding. You'd jump in to save him.
author: John McAfee

quote: I suppose that writers should, in a way, feel flattered by the censorship laws. They show a primitive fear and dread at the fearful magic of print.
author: John Mortimer

quote: Fear is a question: What are you afraid of, and why? Just as the seed of health is in illness, because illness contains information, your fears are a treasure house of self-knowledge if you explore them.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: Injustice is censured because the censures are afraid of suffering, and not from any fear which they have of doing injustice.
author: Plato

quote: I think a lot of self-importance is a product of fear. And fear, living in sort of an un-self-examined fear-based life, tends to lead to narcissism and self-importance.
author: Moby

quote: Do what you fear and fear disappears.
author: David Joseph Schwartz

quote: To fight fear, act. To increase fear - wait, put off postpone.
author: David Joseph Schwartz

quote: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: One thing about being successful is that I stopped being afraid of dying. Once you're a star you're dead already. You're embalmed.
author: Dustin Hoffman

quote: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: We crucify ourselves between two thieves: regret for yesterday and fear of tomorrow.
author: Fulton Oursler

quote: Will dissent be permitted? The answer to that question will determine whether the society is a free society or a fear society.
author: Natan Sharansky

quote: I define fear as standing across the ring from Joe Louis and knowing he wants to go home early.
author: Max Baer

quote: Too many Christians are living in a house of fear and not in the house of love.
author: Brennan Manning

quote: Fear is really powerful it's really useful to me.
author: James McAvoy

quote: From racial profiling and being pulled over just for 'driving while black' to this new phenomenon of killing unarmed people out of some preconceived idea of fear, our lives and our children's lives are not being valued.
author: Al Sharpton

quote: It is wisest to be impartial. If you have health, but are attached to it, you will always be afraid of losing it. And if you fear that loss, but become ill, you will suffer. Why not remain forever joyful in the Self?
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: I don't fear anyone. We don't come to play in this sport.
author: Canelo Alvarez

quote: Secrets of the past! Who does not wish to keep the past locked in a cage like a ferocious beast? The rich are sleepless for fear of thieves. The respectable have to guard their reputations in the same way.
author: Munshi Premchand

quote: The beauty, the poetry of the fear in their eyes. I didn't mind going to jail for, what, five, six hours? It was absolutely worth it.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: Men! The only animal in the world to fear.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: My aim then was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: One of the scary things is that, when you're a kid, you look at your dad as the man who has no fear. When you're an adult, you realize your father had fear, and that you have it, too.
author: David Duchovny

quote: Good and evil do not exist for me any more. The fear of evil is merely a mass projection here and on Earth.
author: Hans Bender

quote: For me it's important to be in balance. To not let fear get in the way of things, to not worry so much about protecting yourself all the time.
author: John Frusciante

quote: Should we fear hackers? Intention is at the heart of this discussion.
author: Kevin Mitnick

quote: I fear my enthusiasm flags when real work is demanded of me.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: I have no fear of making changes, destroying the image, etc., because the painting has a life of its own.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: Whether you're scared of getting into a relationship or taking the new job or a confrontation - you have to size fear up.
author: Chris Pine

quote: Change comes with both fear and some pain. Those two ingredients create mistrust, misunderstanding and misinformation. Such is the process of democracy.
author: David Mixner

quote: The biggest obstacle to wealth is fear. People are afraid to think big, but if you think small, you'll only achieve small things.
author: T. Harv Eker

quote: There's two sorts of fear: one you embrace and one you should listen to and turn the other way.
author: Matthew McConaughey

quote: I really believed that fear is contagious.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: Our Western society is showing its technological muscles in ever more threatening ways, but the experience of fear, anxiety and even despair has increased in equal proportion. Indeed, the paradox is that the powerful giants feel as powerless as a new-born babe.
author: Henri Nouwen

quote: In boxing, I had a lot of fear. Fear was good. But, for the first time, in the bout with Muhammad Ali, I didn't have any fear. I thought, 'This is easy. This is what I've been waiting for'. No fear at all. No nervousness. And I lost.
author: George Foreman

quote: People speak of the fear of the blank canvas as though it is a temporary hesitation, a trembling moment of self-doubt. For me it was more like being abducted from my bed by a clown, thrust into a circus arena with a wicker chair, and told to tame a pissed-off lion in front of an expectant crowd.
author: Hannah Kent

quote: The responses that environmentalists evoke - fear, anxiety, numbness, despair - are not helpful, even if they are understandable. It should be fascinating, even enthralling, to be in the milieu of environmental change.
author: Paul Hawken

quote: I distracted myself from the fear and terrorism by thinking about things like how the universe began and whether time travel is possible.
author: Malala Yousafzai

quote: We consume our tomorrows fretting about our yesterdays.
author: Persius

quote: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: It is almost universally felt that when we call a country democratic we are praising it; consequently, the defenders of every kind of regime claim that it is a democracy, and fear that they might have to stop using the word if it were tied down to any one meaning.
author: George Orwell

quote: Thought is an errand boy, fear a mine of worries.
author: Yunus Emre

quote: You don't have to fear defeat if you believe it may reveal powers that you didn't know you possessed.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Stand before the people you fear and speak your mind - even if your voice shakes.
author: Maggie Kuhn

quote: I definitely feel we're moving forward. There's a lot more understanding... there's less fear and we're working on there being less hatred.
author: Melissa Etheridge

quote: I am grateful that I didn't let fear get the best of me. It only holds you back from possibilities and greatness.
author: Mariska Hargitay

quote: There's fear in everything, but we can't just succumb to that. We have to suppress it, so we get used to suppressing fear to make it through the our day. Otherwise, we'd become paralyzed by them.
author: Eli Roth

quote: We have nothing to fear but fear itself... and, of course, the boogieman.
author: Pat Paulsen

quote: Fear is an underrated emotion. And that's why I think it's very dangerous to try and cosset children from it. A healthy scare is as good as as a healthy laugh. In fact, they're two sides of the same coin. There is a desire to shield from the knocks and bumps of reality.
author: Mark Gatiss

quote: I will not counter the insanity of the PATRIOT Act with an overblown fear of my rights being taken away.
author: Penn Jillette

quote: Courage is managing fear to accomplish what you want to accomplish. And it's a great demonstration of love. It's really what love is. It's finding areas in which other people are more important than you.
author: Rudy Giuliani

quote: The thing about Green Lantern rings is they pick whoever has potential to overcome great fear.
author: Geoff Johns

quote: Time travel was once considered scientific heresy, and I used to avoid talking about it for fear of being labelled a 'crank.'
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: The first step is to distinguish the loving parts of your personality that are active from the frightened parts of your personality that are active - in other words, to learn to distinguish love from fear in you. The second step is to choose love, no matter what.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: There is a fascination with fear. It grabs our attention.
author: Bernard Beckett

quote: There are times when fear is good. It must keep its watchful place at the heart's controls.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Fear tastes like a rusty knife and do not let her into your house.
author: John Cheever

quote: True nobility is exempt from fear.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The first duty of man is to conquer fear; he must get rid of it, he cannot act till then.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Fear is the mother of foresight.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: I'm not at the point where I'd feel safe in a house alone. I would be really scared. I'm the kind of person that when I get up to go use the bathroom I have this big long hallway, and I just know someone's going to jump out and get me.
author: Britney Spears

quote: I have a fear of being boring.
author: Christian Bale

quote: It is the perpetual dread of fear, the fear of fear, that shapes the face of a brave man.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Anyone who agrees to be interviewed must decide where to draw the line between what is public and what is private. But the line can shift, depending on who is asking the questions. What puts someone on guard isn't necessarily the fear of being 'found out.' It sometimes is just the fear of being misunderstood.
author: Terry Gross

quote: Things done well and with a care, exempt themselves from fear.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Fear not those who argue but those who dodge.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Follow the path of the unsafe, independent thinker. Expose your ideas to the dangers of controversy. Speak your mind and fear less the label of 'crackpot' than the stigma of conformity. And on issues that seem important to you, stand up and be counted at any cost.
author: Chauncey Depew

quote: Fear is a disease that eats away at logic and makes man inhuman.
author: Marian Anderson

quote: Fools rush in where incumbents fear to tread.
author: Norman Ralph Augustine

quote: Just as courage imperils life, fear protects it.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: There is not a truth existing which I fear... or would wish unknown to the whole world.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I never dared to be radical when young for fear it would make me conservative when old.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Action cures fear, inaction creates terror.
author: Douglas Horton

quote: What our children have to fear is not the cars on the highways of tomorrow but our own pleasure in calculating the most elegant parameters of their deaths.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: Don't fear change - embrace it.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quote: The components of anxiety, stress, fear, and anger do not exist independently of you in the world. They simply do not exist in the physical world, even though we talk about them as if they do.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Audacity augments courage; hesitation, fear.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: My only fear is that I may live too long. This would be a subject of dread to me.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Only he can take great resolves who has indomitable faith in God and has fear of God.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Fear is the dark room where the Devil develops his negatives.
author: Gary Busey

quote: Columbine was so frightening. And the media took off with it, like everything else, so it instilled more fear in people. You're looking around at school for kids like the ones who committed the shootings, and you feel wrong for doing that, you know?
author: John Robinson

quote: In the cold, shivering twilight, preceding the daybreak of civilization, the dominating emotion of man was fear.
author: Paul Harris

quote: And if the great fear had not come upon me, as it did, and forced me to do my duty, I might have been less good to the people than some man who had never dreamed at all, even with the memory of so great a vision in me.
author: Black Elk

quote: But to be the best, you must face the best. And to overcome your fear, you must deal with the best.
author: Barry Bonds

quote: Almost all the ideas we have about being a man or being a woman are so burdened with pain, anxiety, fear and self-doubt. For many of us, the confusion around this question is excruciating.
author: Andrew Cohen

quote: The hierarchy shouldn't fear what we're doing.
author: William P. Leahy

quote: You don't want too much fear in a market, because people will be blinded to some very good buying opportunities. You don't want too much complacency because people will be blinded to some risk.
author: Ron Chernow

quote: Technology is the fashion of the '90s. It affects everyone, and everyone is interested in it - either from fear of being left behind or because they have a real need to use technology.
author: Jay Chiat

quote: The only prejudice I've found anywhere in TV is in some advertising agencies, and there isn't so much prejudice as just fear.
author: Nat King Cole

quote: Part of the reason that the government's fear mongering is succeeding is because so many people are so ignorant, that it is easier for government to frighten people in submission.
author: James Bovard

quote: But with the right kind of coaching and determination you can accomplish anything and the biggest accomplishment that I feel I got from the film was overcoming that fear.
author: Reese Witherspoon

quote: The abandoned infant's cry is rage, not fear.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: Ultimately, freedom and democracy are stronger than fear and tyranny.
author: Gijs de Vries

quote: Vertigo is the conflict between the fear of falling and the desire to fall.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: To have a great man for an intimate friend seems pleasant to those who have never tried it; those who have, fear it.
author: Homer

quote: Most intellectual people do not believe in God, but they fear him just the same.
author: Wilhelm Reich

quote: Fear comes from uncertainty. When we are absolutely certain, whether of our worth or worthlessness, we are almost impervious to fear.
author: William Congreve

quote: There's no love more intense than the love we have for our kids - and where there is intense love, there is also intense fear lurking beneath the surface.
author: Arianna Huffington

quote: The Japanese do not fear God. They only fear bombs.
author: Jerome Cady

quote: Fear has nothing to do with cowardice. A fellow is only yellow when he lets his fear make him quit.
author: Jerome Cady

quote: Fear tends to manifest itself much more quickly than greed, so volatile markets tend to be on the downside. In up markets, volatility tends to gradually decline.
author: Philip Roth

quote: Americans are in a cycle of fear which leads to people not wanting to spend and not wanting to make investments, and that leads to more fear. We'll break out of it. It takes time.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: My dear brother Barack Obama has a certain fear of free black men. As a young brother who grows up in a white context, brilliant African father, he's always had to fear being a white man with black skin. All he has known culturally is white. He has a certain rootlessness, a deracination.
author: Cornel West

quote: I was in a band in the '90s called Bikini Kill, and we were so freaked out about documentation then, and there was the whole thing, not just about the male gaze, but that people were going to misrepresent you... a kind fear of the mainstream that a lot of us had.
author: Kathleen Hanna

quote: I like those crisis moments - if you're on top of it and don't get pulled under by panic and fear, it's a very bonding thing.
author: Bill Pullman

quote: I think there's a lot projected on beautiful women, period. At least, maybe this is just my fear, but I do sometimes feel dismissed before I've even been allowed to participate. I have moments of feeling really wounded. But I am pretty optimistic, and I do enjoy a lot of my life.
author: Shalom Harlow

quote: There are few things more liberating in this life than having your worst fear realized.
author: Conan O'Brien

quote: I think masculinity is bravado against the mystery of the universe of women. It's just a fear of not knowing what women have that's so powerful. It's this shield they put up to try to get closer.
author: K. D. Lang

quote: I fear no man, no beast or evil, brother.
author: Hulk Hogan

quote: I am living for every day and trying to have less fear, less worry. But I have always worried about everything; it's in my nature. It's the thing that makes me suffer the most.
author: Penelope Cruz

quote: You've got to kick fear to the side, because the payoff is huge.
author: Mariska Hargitay

quote: Anger elicits anger, fear elicits fear, no matter how well meaning we may be.
author: Martha Beck

quote: I won't touch on risky, because that's subjective. People are just afraid of things too much. Afraid of things that don't necessarily merit fear.
author: Frank Ocean

quote: Many a time freedom has been rolled back - and always for the same sorry reason: fear.
author: Molly Ivins

quote: Imagine how wicked society would be if the fear of God and the fear of civil law were both completely removed.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: I'd like to jump out of a plane. I have a fear of heights I'd like to face.
author: Freida Pinto

quote: Bad news sells because the amygdala is always looking for something to fear.
author: Peter Diamandis

quote: I always say three things make a writer: inspiration, obviously; perspiration, doing the work. But the third is desperation. I'm not really fit for anything else, or to have a real job. That fear drives me. The pressure has always been self inflicted.
author: Harlan Coben

quote: But I love being scared. I think you're brave only when you do things that scare you. I've always used fear as a motivator. I'm not sure why.
author: Ginnifer Goodwin

quote: My biggest fear in writing 'Gossip Girl' was that the characters would sound like stereotypical rich, air-headed heiresses. These were my friends. They were smart and multifaceted. They had interests and passions. They wanted to become lawyers and doctors and writers and filmmakers.
author: Cecily von Ziegesar

quote: At the root of the shy temperament is a deep fear of social judgment, one so severe it can sometimes be crippling. Introverted people don't worry unduly about whether they'll be found wanting, they just find too much socializing exhausting and would prefer either to be alone or in the company of a select few people.
author: Jeffrey Kluger

quote: I think that my leadership style is to get people to fear staying in place, to fear not changing.
author: Louis V. Gerstner, Jr.

quote: I've always felt alienated. I realized that I've been terrified my entire life. So I can identify that fear which drives so many of the people that I write about.
author: Hubert Selby, Jr.

quote: I don't think Adam Sandler or Will Ferrell fear competition from me in their arena.
author: Viggo Mortensen

quote: I've always been petrified of working for a boss who I didn't like but who I was in fear of, because I wanted my salary.
author: Simon Cowell

quote: I was a mother who worked ridiculously hard to keep catastrophe at bay. I didn't allow my kids to eat hamburgers for fear of E. coli. I didn't allow them to play with rope, string, balloons - anything that might strangle them. They had to bite grapes in half, avoid lollipops, eat only when I could watch them.
author: Ann Hood

quote: I've done plenty of daredeviling - from white-water rafting to bungee jumping. But I think the most fearless was hosting the Emmy Awards. It was overwhelming, and I definitely had to leave fear at the door.
author: Neil Patrick Harris

quote: I have turned away from the thought of writing fiction in the past through what I suppose is, actually, fear. The direct, raw invitation for the reader to come in and explore my imagination is fairly scary for me so I have busied myself with so much else.
author: Dawn French

quote: My dad had this thing - everyone in Canada wants to play hockey; that's all they want to do. So when I was a kid, whenever we skated my dad would not let us on the ice without hockey sticks, because of this insane fear we would become figure skaters!
author: Norm MacDonald

quote: Just what is it that academics have to fear if they stand up for common decency, instead of letting campus barbarians run amok?
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Instead of showing strangers kindness and giving them the benefit of the doubt, we increasingly show them only fear, and that is bad for us and them.
author: Julian Baggini

quote: For me personally, I have a fear of, 'If I stop, I'm going to die.' If I stop doing the things that are enriching to me or creatively exciting to me or if I stop creating, then I feel stagnant. If something isn't growing, it's dying.
author: Chris Hardwick

quote: We can fear things into existence. Fear looks into the future and imagines the worst that can happen.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: Most serious writers refuse to make themselves available to the things that technology is doing. I've never been able to understand this sort of fear.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: In the end, I am quite normal. I don't have odd habits. I don't dramatize. Above all, I do not romanticize the act of writing. I don't talk about the anguish I suffer in creating. I do not have a fear of the blank page, writer's block, all those things that we hear about writers.
author: Jose Saramago

quote: The stereotypes of feminists as ugly, or man-haters, or hairy, or whatever it is - that's really strategic. That's a really smart way to keep young women away from feminism, is to kind of put out this idea that all feminists hate men, or all feminists are ugly; and that they really come from a place of fear.
author: Jessica Valenti

quote: The economics of the security world are all horribly, horribly nasty and are largely based on fear, intimidation and blackmail.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: I don't even know why, but I've just always done it - I don't walk on handicapped parking spaces. I don't like to step on the blue lines. I always step over them. I don't know what the deal is. I don't know if it's a fear of injury, or a disrespectful thing, or if I just don't want to think about something like that happening.
author: Chantal Sutherland

quote: Essentially, I am a dreamer. I've dreamed all my life. When I started, I dreamed I'd be Champion because it is a sport that is all about the people who win the most, and I have a fear of not winning.
author: Tony McCoy

quote: The impression left after watching the motions of birds is that of extreme mobility - a life of perpetual impulse checked only by fear.
author: Richard Jefferies

quote: I have struggled for decades now with the fear of and resistance to change - mostly in the realms of technology, transportation, and the ways people choose to communicate. If I had a theme song, it would be that lovely song 'I'm Old-Fashioned,' as sung by Ella Fitzgerald.
author: Julia Glass

quote: The most blatant forms of denialism are rarely malevolent; they combine decency, a fear of change, and the misguided desire to do good - for our health, our families, and the world. That is why so many physicians dismiss the idea that a patient's race can, and often should, be used as a tool for better diagnoses and treatment.
author: Michael Specter

quote: Californians are people who insist on growing their own vegetables, but they won't dig up the pretty lawn, won't plant anything for fear of getting dirty, and they use fragrant bath salts from The Body Shop instead of smelly compost.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: My father was a mean, controlling and manipulative person for most of his life. He was unpredictable and unstable. As a result, the atmosphere of our home was super-charged with fear because you never knew if what you did would make him mad or not.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: A person's fears are lighter when the danger is at hand.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The problem is not getting rid of fear, but using it properly.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: You pretend to be more eccentric than you actually are because you fear you are an interchangeable cog.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: It is the strange fate of man, that even in the greatest of evils the fear of the worst continues to haunt him.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: You know why I fear people's judgment? Because I know they're judging. I know they are.
author: Kate Winslet

quote: Fighter pilots have ice in their veins. They don't have emotions. They think, anticipate. They know that fear and other concerns cloud your mind from what's going on and what you should be involved in.
author: Buzz Aldrin

quote: When you want to die, you at least have a goal. You're aiming for something. It's not a good goal, but at least you want something. And you've got anger and fear, but at least you're feeling something.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: My biggest fear is mindlessly and stupidly repeating myself.
author: John Lydon

quote: Fear makes us feel our humanity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: If someone's got a fear of heights, they'd probably say, well, hanging off a helicopter at 3,000 feet above downtown L.A. would be the scariest. For me, that's a day's work, something I was very happy to do.
author: Jason Statham

quote: Why is it that when we get older, we get more fearful?
author: Sandra Bullock

quote: The fearful unbelief is unbelief in yourself.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: I do not trust those who make the vaccines, or the apparatus behind it all to push it on us through fear.
author: Billy Corgan

quote: To him who is in fear everything rustles.
author: Sophocles

quote: The terrorists are fighting freedom with all their cunning and cruelty because freedom is their greatest fear - and they should be afraid, because freedom is on the march.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
author: Charles Kennedy

quote: When fear makes your choices for you, no security measures on earth will keep the things you dread from finding you. But if you can avoid avoidance - if you can choose to embrace experiences out of passion, enthusiasm, and a readiness to feel whatever arises - then nothing, nothing in all this dangerous world, can keep you from being safe.
author: Martha Beck

quote: People's choice to become vegan, from people I've spoken to, seems motivated by fear.
author: Anthony Bourdain

quote: Everyone wishes that the man whom he fears would perish.
author: Ovid

quote: Minds that are ill at ease are agitated by both hope and fear.
author: Ovid

quote: So here we are today with a new conversation. When University of Georgia plays Georgia Tech, it's uniform color versus skin color. We have - we've overcome that level of racial fear.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Sides are being divided now. It's very obvious. So if you're on the other side of the fence, you're suddenly anti-American. It's breeding fear of being on the wrong side.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: The fear of becoming a 'has-been' keeps some people from becoming anything.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: We have perhaps a natural fear of ends. We would rather be always on the way than arrive. Given the means, we hang on to them and often forget the ends.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Fear clogs faith liberates.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: I'd rather give my life than be afraid to give it.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: For any new technology there is always controversy and there always some fear associated with it. I think that's just the price of being first sometimes.
author: Hugh Grant

quote: We are afraid of the enormity of the possible.
author: Emile M. Cioran

quote: You know, sometimes I feel well and vital in the world, and sometimes I just feel so distressed I want to pull my hair out by the roots.
author: Sharon Stone

quote: What people recognize is that there's a fear that the United States is in an unstoppable decline. They see the rise of China, the rise of India, the rise of the Soviet Union and our loss militarily going forward.
author: Michele Bachmann

quote: Sleep makes people calmer, more alert, less fearful - just plain happier, or so I see around me and in me. I am sure that if this great nation were to concentrate on getting more sleep, we would be a happier, more confident people, and that by itself would be a major achievement.
author: Ben Stein

quote: We often pretend to fear what we really despise, and more often despise what we really fear.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: I fear we might be losing the basic human facility to be alone - and with that you throw out independent decision-making, what to trust, what not to trust; key stuff - a perilous loss.
author: Dylan Moran

quote: As with most phobias, the fear of flying does make some sense, but if ever there was a fear worth quashing then this is it. After all, life is short, and there's a great big world to explore out there.
author: Beth Ditto

quote: I went to school with butterflies of fear every day for years - from primary school onwards - not just worried about being bullied by classmates, but by teachers.
author: Robert Winston

quote: I fear the Greeks, even when they bring gifts.
author: Virgil

quote: Some people need to stay at the top. They are afraid to re-start from zero because they fear the critics.
author: Eric Cantona

quote: The thinner the ice, the more anxious is everyone to see whether it will bear.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Fear, anxiety and neurosis: that's just in the suitcase when you're an actor.
author: Laura Linney

quote: The deepest fear we have, 'the fear beneath all fears,' is the fear of not measuring up, the fear of judgment. It's this fear that creates the stress and depression of everyday life.
author: Tullian Tchividjian

quote: A star on a movie set is like a time bomb. That bomb has got to be defused so people can approach it without fear.
author: Jack Nicholson

quote: The thirst for powerful sensations takes the upper hand both over fear and over compassion for the grief of others.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Fear is a driving force for most of the things that I do. I don't know if that's healthy.
author: David Chang

quote: I would sum up my fear about the future in one word: boring. And that's my one fear: that everything has happened; nothing exciting or new or interesting is ever going to happen again... the future is just going to be a vast, conforming suburb of the soul.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: I'm different, and my manner invites questions. I'm never afraid to answer.
author: Marlee Matlin

quote: He whom many fear, has himself many to fear.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: The brutal truth is, we're scarcely 'educating' children at all. Even if you overlook the guilt, fear, bigotry, and dangerous anti-intellectual flapdoodle being funneled into young brains by schools on the religious right, what we're doing is training kids to be cogs in the wheels of commerce.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: But what is all this fear of and opposition to Oblivion? What is the matter with the soft Darkness, the Dreamless Sleep?
author: James Thurber

quote: I always have the fear that, if I don't commit 100 percent to my work, then it's gonna suffer.
author: Joaquin Phoenix

quote: I have a son, who is a... not an ordinary form of schizophrenia, but clearly, cannot take care of himself. And the great fear of then, of all parents is, when the parents die, who takes care of your child? And the answer is: they become homeless.
author: James D. Watson

quote: It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: That man is prudent who neither hopes nor fears anything from the uncertain events of the future.
author: Anatole France

quote: I am drawn to those parts; I like the tough girls because they are not tough. It's a veil; it's a disguise. It's defenses. At the core, everybody is human, everybody is fragile, everybody is terrified, and the fear is what propels you to be tough.
author: Tatiana Maslany

quote: This is all you have. This is not a dry run. This is your life. If you want to fritter it away with your fears, then you will fritter it away, but you won't get it back later.
author: Laura Schlessinger

quote: I came seriously close to getting married four times, and each time I backed off in fear or for one reason or another. Each occasion was different, but in hindsight when I look at the people involved, it wasn't a bad thing what I did. I think it may have been more complex had the marriage taken place.
author: Ratan Tata

quote: So then learn to conquer your fear. This is the only art we have to master nowadays: to look at things without fear, and to fearlessly do right.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: When you advise any person you should be guided by the fear of God.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: I won't allow myself to have tremendous fear.
author: Calvin Klein

quote: We lavish on animals the love we are afraid to show to people. They might not return it; or worse, they might.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: It's the most unhappy people who most fear change.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: To me, my biggest fear is getting a big head, and that is when I get the hammer. Because it's very easy in this game to believe you're something special.
author: Keith Richards

quote: One had to take some action against fear when once it laid hold of one.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The forgotten world is made up primarily of the developing nations, where most of the people, comprising more than fifty percent of the total world population, live in poverty, with hunger as a constant companion and fear of famine a continual menace.
author: Norman Borlaug

quote: Laughter kills fear, and without fear there can be no faith. For without fear of the devil there is no need for God.
author: Sean Connery

quote: Hate is the consequence of fear we fear something before we hate it a child who fears noises becomes a man who hates noise.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbours will say.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: As repressed sadists are supposed to become policemen or butchers so those with an irrational fear of life become publishers.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: There's a certain fear of simplicity. I think that's the thing, when you're younger as an artist, you get this idea in your head that complexity equals quality. The more notes you're playing, the better.
author: Patrick Stump

quote: We all have our ways of handling fear and managing trying; jumping in or climbing down, a direct approach or a delay, joyful or miserable, a spirit of adventure, or God help me, get this thing over with.
author: Kristin Armstrong

quote: The fear of the never-ending onslaught of gizmos and gadgets is nothing new. The radio, the telephone, Facebook - each of these inventions changed the world. Each of them scared the heck out of an older generation. And each of them was invented by people who were in their 20s.
author: Daniel H. Wilson

quote: Fear is not in the habit of speaking truth; when perfect sincerity is expected, perfect freedom must be allowed; nor has anyone who is apt to be angry when he hears the truth any cause to wonder that he does not hear it.
author: Tacitus

quote: There is nothing that fear and hope does not permit men to do.
author: Luc de Clapiers

quote: Therefore, when I considered this carefully, the contempt which I had to fear because of the novelty and apparent absurdity of my view, nearly induced me to abandon utterly the work I had begun.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quote: Tell us your phobias and we will tell you what you are afraid of.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: To me, watching a movie is like going to an amusement park. My worst fear is making a film that people don't think is a good ride.
author: Darren Aronofsky

quote: The great thing about behavioural psychology and economics is that they help us to see that there are actually pretty good reasons why human beings swing from greed to fear, and why we're not really calculating machines or utility-maximisers.
author: Niall Ferguson

quote: I was a very fearful little kid, and I would always see the worst in everything. The glass was half-empty. I would see people kissing, and I would think one was trying to bite the other.
author: Daniel Clowes

quote: It seemed that rebellion must have an unassailable base, something guarded not merely from attack, but from the fear of it: such a base as we had in the Red Sea Parts, the desert, or in the minds of the men we converted to our creed.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: An ugly sight, a man who is afraid.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: I don't fear aging. It's natural, and I can't stop it!
author: Madhuri Dixit

quote: There's always an element of fear that you need to work a lot until people get sick and tired of you or finally figure out that you're a fraud after all!
author: Ben Stiller

quote: Monopolists who fear competition and who distrust democracy because it stands for equal opportunity would like to secure their position against small and energetic enterprise.
author: Henry A. Wallace

quote: In contrast, fear societies are societies in which dissent is banned.
author: Natan Sharansky

quote: Right out of high school I never had the fear of getting beat, which is how most people lose.
author: Dan Gable

quote: My apartment is the equivalent of one room in my Toronto home. Now I understand why New Yorkers are on the streets at all hours. People don't want to stay inside for fear they'll go crazy.
author: Samantha Bee

quote: The world has nothing to fear from military ambition in our Government.
author: James K. Polk

quote: Fear of the unknown is a terrible fear.
author: Joan D. Vinge

quote: We need a pedagogy free from fear and focused on the magic of children's innate quest for information and understanding.
author: Sugata Mitra

quote: I began to realize that when people experience the love of God, it casts out their fear and frees them from guilt.
author: Joseph Prince

quote: I'd love to work with Aaron Sorkin on something. Just the way he writes, he has no fear in writing people that are fiercely intelligent, and I love that.
author: David Tennant

quote: I could write an entertaining novel about rejection slips, but I fear it would be overly long.
author: Louise Brown

quote: Preachers prepare with this fear: 'Am I going to be able to fill the time?' The audience never worries about that.
author: Andy Stanley

quote: A line from one of my 1997 columns - 'Do one thing every day that scares you' - is now widely attributed to Eleanor Roosevelt, though I have yet to see any evidence that she ever said it and I don't believe she did. She said some things about fear, but not that thing.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: I fear God never showed mercy to one so vile as I.
author: David Brainerd

quote: Jealousy is the fear or apprehension of superiority: envy our uneasiness under it.
author: William Shenstone

quote: Whatever hardships there have been in my life I still live in a very privileged position. Fear is not knowing where your next meal is coming from. Fear is seeing a child get hurt. Fear is watching someone you love waste away. Fear is knowing you are going to die yourself. But there's no fear in what I do. I write books.
author: James Frey

quote: Too many people don't do things for fear of falling. You'll never get good unless you fall. Experiences and new accomplishments are feelings we should never lose.
author: Robin Quivers

quote: Show me a guy who's afraid to look bad, and I'll show you a guy you can beat every time.
author: Lou Brock

quote: We fear the thing we want the most.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: A child understands fear, and the hurt and hate it brings.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: Our democracy is predicated on the belief that our government should be accessible by the people. We cannot allow ourselves to give in to fear or shy away from interacting with the public.
author: Erik Paulsen

quote: Most fear stems from sin; to limit one's sins, one must assuredly limit one's fear, thereby bringing more peace to one's spirit.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: These days, all we hear about is that the industry is in trouble. Everybody is so scared, but our mission statement is having no fear.
author: Frank Iero

quote: I am always scared before going on stage this is the fear which makes me do well.
author: Kapil Sharma

quote: I don't feel that fear is a good incentive on a film set.
author: Andrew Lincoln

quote: We should not be afraid to go into a new era, to leave the old beyond.
author: Zack Wamp

quote: It seems to me we have been in a rhetorical arms race in this country, with each side unwilling to lay down its weapons for fear - usually justified - the other side would beat them to a pulp.
author: Pat Sajak

quote: We tell lies when we are afraid... afraid of what we don't know, afraid of what others will think, afraid of what will be found out about us. But every time we tell a lie, the thing that we fear grows stronger.
author: Tad Williams

quote: Do what you fear most and you control fear.
author: Tom Hopkins

quote: I hasten to laugh at everything, for fear of being obliged to weep.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: I love overcoming challenges and fear.
author: Laura Wilkinson

quote: When you're fearful, you stumble.
author: Jenna Jameson

quote: Chemistry itself knows altogether too well that - given the real fear that the scarcity of global resources and energy might threaten the unity of mankind - chemistry is in a position to make a contribution towards securing a true peace on earth.
author: Kenichi Fukui

quote: Everything I've ever done was out of fear of being mediocre.
author: Chet Atkins

quote: Discipline is simply the art of making the soldiers fear their officers more than the enemy.
author: Claude Adrien Helvetius

quote: I don't want fear or cancer to define me, but it's always in the back of your mind.
author: Ethan Zohn

quote: To show a 'well-founded fear of persecution', an alien need not prove that it is more likely than not that he or she will be persecuted in his or her home country.
author: John Paul Stevens

quote: You know, once something freezes, it's solid. That's the key to the arctic - they didn't fear the cold, they made use of it.
author: Wade Davis

quote: If children live with hostility, they learn to fight. If they live with fear, they learn to be apprehensive. If they live with criticism, they learn to condemn.
author: Ron Finley
